text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with grilled coffee Cola
skirt steak that's right of course
coffee and cola are great beverages but
as i discovered they make an incredibly
delicious marinade for grilled meats and
not just any grilled meat we're doing
skirt steak which is by far the juiciest
and most flavorful piece of beef you can
put on a grill so step one here we're
going to make the aforementioned
marinade which starts off with a couple
cloves of minced garlic to that i'm
going to add a little bit of ketchup
we're going to add some freshly ground
black pepper
we're also going to add some salt and
some dried rosemary now of course you
could use fresh rosemary but I do like
to dry better for this not exactly sure
why I'm also going to add some hot sauce
I'm using Louisiana Hot Sauce
but I think a hot sauce from any state
would work I'm also going to add a
splash of rice vinegar and then the
costars of the marinade some strong
coffee and a bottle of Cola and you can
use any color you want as long as it's
not diet we need the sugar so do not use
diet if you use diet cola I can no
longer consider you a friend so we're
just going to dump all that into a bowl
we're going to take a whisk and we're
going to mix it up and that marinade is
done
alright so very easy so we're going to
mix that up set that aside while we prep
our skirt steak and here it is this long
thin strip of marvelously marbled meat
is called a skirt steak bite butchers
who think it looks like a skirt butchers
obviously don't get out much because it
looks much more like a scarf steak or a
sash steak than a skirt steak but anyway
it's too late they already named it so
we're going to unroll our skirt steak
and you can clearly see the way the
grain of the meats running so later when
this is done we're going to want to cut
across that and we're going to cut it up
into smaller pieces which is going to
make it much easier to grill and as
you'll see later cuts so we're going to
take our scissors and cut it every six
inches or so and of course we're using
scissors because it's a skirt steak that
and I didn't want to dirty a cutting
board so we're going to cut that up here
we'll cut that little end piece off and
trim a little fat and we're going to go
ahead and place that into our coffee
Cola marinade making sure it's totally
submerged if you were thinking you get
away with partial submersion you're
wrong make sure they're all immersed and
then we'll take a piece of plastic wrap
push that down on top and that meat is
going to marinate overnight
so I'll give the official timeframe is 8
to 12 hours so I say it's overnight but
you could totally do this early in the
morning and then grill later that
afternoon
so regardless 8 to 12 hours later we're
going to pull that out we're going to
pull it out of the marinade which you
are not throwing away by the way reserve
the marinade so we're going to pull out
that meat we're going to put it on a
plate and then please take a paper towel
and Pat this dry we do not want to
season wet meat and then we'll just
leave that there while we dump our
marinade into a saucepan because one
optional step that I'm going to make
mandatory is that you reduce this on
medium heat until it thickens up
slightly kind of down to a glaze
we don't want it super thick and syrupy
so something like that and we're not
going to use this to brush on the meat
it doesn't need it but what we will do
is drizzle this over after we slice it
and it really does make an incredibly
flavorful sauce as you'll see and by the
way this meat grills pretty fast so I
usually will reduce that before I go out
to the grill but that's just me and then
we're going to go back to the meat which
like I said has been patted thoroughly
dry I'm going to season both sides
lightly with salt and cayenne and then
we're going to head out back where I
have a very hot charcoal fire very
mature
you see the white-hot coals glowing red
I'm going to grill that for
approximately four minutes per side or
until it's a perfect pink and because of
the sugar in that Cola in the marinade
you are going to get nice dark golden
brown to golden black grill marks all
right you want those I'll part of the
show and at this point let me give you a
few skirt steak grilling tips number one
if you have a piece that's thin at one
end and thicker at the other if you
think that thin n is done simply lay
that end of the meat over another piece
which will insulate it from the direct
heat and that thicker end will finish
cooking and the thin end won't be
overcooked also if you're afraid of it
getting too dark you can always move it
away from the hottest part of the flame
so I kind of move mine off to the side
here and then last but not least skirt
steak has a great built-in indicator for
when it's perfectly pink the surface
will start to get shiny and look wet as
moisture from the inside is forced up to
the surface this is an indication the
center is just about medium-rare to
medium which is how I think skirt steak
should be eaten I'll explain on the blog
post why I don't think skirt steak
should be cooked rare but when you see
that sheen on the top and it looks like
it's getting a little wet that for me is
the sign to pull
it off of course yes you can use a
thermometer or go by feel but for me
that always works but anyway at this
point my meat was done I'm going to pull
it off the grill and we're going to take
that inside of course and let it rest
for at least at least five minutes this
is critical with most meats off the
grill but especially something is juicy
a skirt steak so let it sit for five
minutes and then of course you're going
to go ahead and slice it across the
grain
alright the muscle fibers on skirt steak
are very easy to see so you're going to
make sure you're cutting across those
just like this so we're going to slice
that up and you can see just how
incredibly juicy and awesome that meat
is I mean look at that I didn't even
have to taste it to know this was going
to be just perfect so we're going to
slice that up we're going to throw it on
a plate we're gonna drizzle over just a
little bit of that coffee Cola reduction
I did go ahead and strain that I wanted
it to be a little fancy but you really
don't have to but I did
I served mine with a little bit of
coleslaw that I'm going to show you the
recipe for soon enough and that was just
a magnificent magnificent piece of
grilled meat just smoky subtly sweet the
flavors balanced perfectly by the
bitterness from the coffee and the grill
marks just absolutely fantastic so if
you're looking for something a little
out of the ordinary this summer I cannot
recommend this marinade enough and of
course if you're not down with skirt
steak you need to get down very easy to
cook incredibly flavorful with a level
of juiciness that has to be experienced
to be believed so I really really hope
you give this a try head over to food
wishes comm for all the ingredient
amounts and more info as usual and as
always enjoy
you
